Expectation1: Complete assigned tasks by the agreed deadlines
Situation1: The task feeds directly into the next teammate’s work and delays would ripple.
Situation2: A winter storm is slowing traffic while the passenger must catch an international flight
Story: I stared at my laptop, the cursor blinking on the half-finished report. My colleague, Priya, had just messaged, “Will you have it by noon? I need it to finish my part.” I knew if I missed the deadline, the whole team’s project would be delayed. But my phone buzzed again—my taxi app. A passenger had booked a ride to the airport, and the winter storm outside was already snarling traffic. The passenger’s note was urgent: “International flight, please hurry.” I felt the weight of both worlds pressing on me. As a colleague, I owed my team reliability; as a taxi driver, I owed my passenger a safe, timely ride. My mind raced: if I left now, I’d miss the work deadline. If I stayed, my passenger might miss their flight. The snow kept falling, and I sat frozen, torn between two lives, each demanding more than I could give.
